intro: Chonemorpha pubescens, commonly known as the hairy chonemorpha, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Chonemorpha pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
